conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force on the trapezoidal frame.
The frame is made of a uniform-thickness resistance wire with resistivity \(\rho\) and cross-sectional area \(S\).
Calculate the total length of the wire using the cosine rule: \(AD = L\).
The total length of the wire is \(L_{\text{total}} = 4L\).
The total resistance \(R\) of the wire is \(R = \rho \frac{4L}{S}\).
The current \(I\) in the frame is \(I = \frac{ES}{4\rho L}\).
The Ampere force on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by \(F = I L B \sin(\theta)\).
For sides \(AB\), \(BC\), and \(CD\), the force is \(F_{AB} = F_{BC} = F_{CD} = \frac{ESB}{4\rho}\).
The direction of the resultant force is perpendicular to the plane of the frame and outward.
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force is \(\boxed{\frac{3ESB}{4\rho}}\).
